newsitem.title: FRANCE: Daewoo says other French partner unlikely.
newsitem.headline: Daewoo says other French partner unlikely.

text.p: Daewoo Electronics said it was unrealistic that another French company could bid for Thomson Multimedia (TMM) or join the share capital.

"From the beginning, the French government asked for a global proposal on Thomson-CSF and TMM. Did the government change the rules?," Daewoo Electronics chairman Bae Soon-hoon told a news conference on Tuesday.

"When the French government asked for our bid they asked us how we would operate Thomson Multimedia over the next two years. I made a plan and that did not include the participation of Sagem or any other French company," Bae said.
Sagem strongly denied a newspaper report it was planning a bid for Thomson Multimedia aimed at blocking its sale to Daewoo.

Bae had no direct comment on some political and labour opposition to his plans. "I do not believe that people do not want to work for me," he said, repeating his promise to create 5,000 new jobs in France.
